"step_by_step_thinking": "From the document 'Mechanism of methacholine-induced rise in intraocular pressure in the dog', it is mentioned that methacholine stimulation of ciliary muscle contraction with consequent thickening of the lens as responsible for its intraocular pressure-elevating effect. This suggests that methacholine acts on muscarinic receptors, specifically M3 receptor which is involved in contraction of smooth muscles including the ciliary muscle.

From the document 'Muscarinic cholinergic receptor modulation of beta-adrenergic receptor affinity for catecholamines', it is mentioned that methacholine antagonized the guanine nucleotide-induced reduction in beta-adrenergic receptor affinity for isoproterenol, and this effect was reversed by atropine. This suggests that methacholine acts on muscarinic receptors to modulate the effects of GTP.
